Geographical analyses with R

A wide variety of R packages are available to read, visualize and process vector and raster maps with R. An overview of R packages for the analyses of spatial data.

  • Load and plot raster maps in R. Download layers from online data repositories, plot maps and save images with legends.
  • Load and plot vector maps in R. Download layers, perform a spatial join between tables and GOS layers, plot maps with and related statistics.
  • Load and plot online maps reproject and overlay raster and vector layers.
  • Kappa statistics tutorial for comparing categorical maps.
  • Analysis of the spatial covariance between maps.
  • r_cross

Interesting readings

  • Yuri M. Zhukov Basics of Geographic Analysis in R
  • R Spatial Cheatsheet
  • sp and lattice libraries to visualize spatial data.
  • geosphere package tutorial on mapping connections.
  • a ggplot2 tutorial
  • ggplot2 cheatsheet
  • NEON tutorial on R raster data. NEON is devoted to open data and open source in science and education.
